org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.mongodb.options

Annotation Type WriteConcern


  • @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD,FIELD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface WriteConcern
    Specifies the write concern to be applied when performing write operations to the annotated entity or property. Can either be given using a pre-configured write concern such as WriteConcernType.JOURNALED or by specifying the type of a custom WriteConcern implementation.

    When given on the property-level, this setting will only take effect when the property represents an association. If given for non-association properties, the setting on the property-level will be ignored and the setting from the entity will be applied.

    Author:
    Davide D'Alto <davide@hibernate.org>, Gunnar Morling

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      WriteConcernType value
      Specifies the write concern to be applied when performing write operations to the annotated entity or property.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends com.mongodb.WriteConcern> type
      Specifies a custom WriteConcern implementation.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract WriteConcernType value
        Specifies the write concern to be applied when performing write operations to the annotated entity or property.

        Use WriteConcernType.CUSTOM in conjunction with type() to specify a custom WriteConcern implementation. This is useful in cases where the pre-defined configurations are not sufficient, e.g. if you want to ensure that writes are propagated to a specific number of replicas or given "tag set".

        Returns:
        the corresponding WriteConcernType

      • type

        public abstract Class<? extends com.mongodb.WriteConcern> type
        Specifies a custom WriteConcern implementation. Only takes effect if value() is set to WriteConcernType.CUSTOM. The specified type must have a default (no-args) constructor.
        Returns:
        the WriteConcern to use when WriteConcernType.CUSTOM is set
        Default:
        com.mongodb.WriteConcern.class
